newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Uraco says no impact from CAM troubles.
newsitem.headline: Uraco says no impact from CAM troubles.

text.p: Electronics-based Uraco Holdings Ltd has told shareholders the company has not been affected by allegations of fraud by two directors at CAM International Holdings Ltd.

"The board of directors of the company would like to reaffirm and assure shareholders that the company's operations are in no way affected by the development at CAM and the company remains fundamentally sound," Uraco said in a statement to the stock exchange late on Wednesday.
Uraco bought 15.6 million shares, or a 6.48 percent stake, in CAM for Singapore $15.6 million in February last year.
Uraco's share price was under selling pressure earlier this week after news broke out of possible fraud at CAM.
Uraco said it bought CAM shares as a long-term investment and has no other business dealings with the company.
Singapore's white crime busters, the Commercial Affairs Department (CAD), said on Tuesday they were looking into the matter after receiving a complaint from the Ministry of Finance.
Auditors Ernst & Young had sent a report to the ministry saying two directors could have committed breaches of trust in suspicious transactions through CAM subsidiaries.
The report was made public by the Stock Exchange of Singapore (SES) on Monday night.
At 0412 GMT, Uraco topped the actives with 5.8 million units traded and its share price nudged up S$0.03 to S$0.87.
